alert.note: Alert for Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Newton and eastern Scott Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1250 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Forest, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lawrence around 100 PM CDT. Conehatta around 110 PM CDT. Prospect and Stratton around 120 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lake and Sebastopol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central and east central Mississippi.
